comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: >T.R. Peel (LOC) This would be T.R. (Theodore Roosevelt) Pell, who was defeated by Karl H. Behr, the former internationalist, in the semi-final round of the Middle States men's singles championship, June 27, 1914, on the courts of the South Orange Lawn Tennis Club at South Orange (Mountain), New Jersey. Behr went on to play Gustave F. Touchard, who was the current title holder, for the Middle States Men's Singles Championship Title. — The New York Times T.R. Pell was a member of the West Side Tennis Club at Forest Hills, Long Island, NY.
